text: Choose the correct spelling.
explanation: The correct spelling is 'accommodate' which has double 'c' and double 'm'.

text: Choose the word that is most similar in meaning to 'benevolent'.
explanation: ‘Benevolent’ means kind or charitable.

text: Which of the following sentences is grammatically correct?
explanation: ‘Each of the students has submitted his or her project’ is grammatically correct.

choices.text: Each of the students have submitted their projects.
Each of the students has submitted his or her project.
Each students has submitted their project.

text: Identify the correct analogy: Hand is to glove as foot is to ____.
explanation: A glove covers the hand; a sock covers the foot.

text: Choose the correct form: He insisted ____ paying the bill.
explanation: We use ‘on’ after ‘insist’.

text: Choose the best word to complete the sentence: She is very good ___ singing.
explanation: The correct preposition after ‘good’ when referring to a skill is ‘at’.

text: Which of the following is the opposite of ‘ancient’?
explanation: The opposite of ‘ancient’ is ‘modern’.

text: Choose the word that best completes the sentence: The committee will ____ the report tomorrow.
explanation: The correct word is ‘review’ meaning to examine or evaluate.

text: Which word is most similar in meaning to ‘meticulous’?
explanation: ‘Meticulous’ means very careful or precise.

text: Identify the correct spelling.
explanation: ‘Occurrence’ has a double ‘r’ and double ‘c’.

text: Choose the correct sentence.
explanation: ‘Neither the teacher nor the students were present’ is correct because the plural subject ‘students’ is nearest the verb.

choices.text: Neither the teacher nor the students was present.
Neither the teacher nor the students were present.
Neither the teachers nor the student were present.

text: Which of the following best completes the analogy: Pen is to write as knife is to ____.
explanation: A pen is used to write; a knife is used to cut.

text: Choose the correct word: He was too tired to continue, so he decided to ____.
explanation: ‘Rest’ fits the context; it means to take a break or pause.

text: Which of the following sentences uses the correct verb tense?
explanation: ‘She has finished her project on time’ correctly uses the present perfect tense.

choices.text: She has finish her project on time.
She has finished her project on time.
She have finished her project on time.

text: Find the word opposite in meaning to ‘transparent’.
explanation: The opposite of ‘transparent’ (clear) is ‘opaque’ (not clear).

text: Choose the correct article: He bought ____ umbrella before the storm.
explanation: The correct article is ‘an’ because ‘umbrella’ starts with a vowel sound.

text: Which word is similar in meaning to ‘diligent’?
explanation: ‘Diligent’ means hardworking and careful.

text: Select the correct preposition: He is responsible ____ the new project.
explanation: We use ‘for’ with ‘responsible’.

text: Which sentence is correctly punctuated?
explanation: ‘After lunch, we went back to work.’ has the correct comma placement.

choices.text: After lunch we went back to work.
After lunch, we went back to work.
After, lunch we went back to work.

text: Which pair of words is an example of a synonym?
explanation: ‘Big’ and ‘large’ have the same meaning.

text: Identify the correct analogy: Book is to reading as fork is to ____.
explanation: A book is used for reading; a fork is used for eating.

text: Choose the correctly spelled word.
explanation: ‘Separate’ is the correct spelling.

text: Select the correct sentence.
explanation: ‘She and I went to the market’ correctly uses the subject pronouns.

choices.text: Her and me went to the market.
She and I went to the market.
She and me went to the market.

text: Find the word that means the same as ‘brief’.
explanation: ‘Brief’ means short in duration or length.

text: Which word best completes the sentence: Please ____ your seat before the show starts.
explanation: ‘Occupy’ fits the context, meaning to take or fill a seat.

text: Choose the correct form of the verb: The manager and his assistant ____ present at the meeting.
explanation: When subjects are joined by ‘and’, the verb should be plural: ‘were’.
